question: 満点
sourceMnemonic:
<kanji>Full</kanji> <kanji>point</kanji>s are when you get a <vocabulary>perfect score</vocabulary>.

<ja>満点</ja> can also be used to describe a state of being at the pinnacle of a certain quality or standard, such as <ja>サービス満点</ja> (excellent service) or <ja>栄養満点</ja> (highly nutritious).
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
